question_1.question: What is the first step to add a new environment in TimeXtender according to the article?

options.option_a: Select the instances to include in the environment.
options.option_b: Navigate to Data estate > Environments and click Add environment.
options.option_d: Click on the edit icon to modify an existing environment.

question_1.explanation: The first step to add a new environment is to navigate to Data estate > Environments and click Add environment, as stated in the provided instructions.

question_2.question: What must be true for an instance to be transferred to another in TimeXtender?

options.option_a: The instances must be of different types.
options.option_b: The instances must be part of the same environment.
options.option_c: The instances must be of the same type.
options.option_d: The destination instance must be a new instance.

question_2.explanation: An instance can only be transferred to another instance of the same type, as mentioned in the article.

question_3.question: What is the primary benefit of installing TimeXtender services and SQL Server databases on the same Windows server?

options.option_b: It offers performance advantages due to zero network latency.
options.option_c: It allows for unlimited user access.
options.option_d: It simplifies the SQL Server licensing requirements.

question_3.explanation: Installing TimeXtender services and SQL Server databases on the same server offers performance advantages due to zero network latency, making maintenance easier.

question_4.question: What is a recommended practice before finalizing the server configuration for TimeXtender?

options.option_a: Consulting the default settings provided by TimeXtender.
options.option_b: Using the minimum hardware requirements as a guideline.
options.option_c: Conducting your own testing or obtaining an expert recommendation.
options.option_d: Copying the configuration from another organization.

question_4.explanation: It is recommended to conduct your own testing or obtain an expert recommendation due to the varying analytics environments and factors impacting performance.

question_5.question: What is the first step to deploy the TimeXtender Application Server on Azure?

options.option_c: Configure your desired properties for the Virtual Machine
options.option_d: Navigate to the TimeXtender Application Server Azure Deployment

question_5.explanation: The first step is to sign in to the Azure portal at https://portal.azure.com before deploying the TimeXtender Application Server.

question_6.question: Approximately how long does it take to deploy the necessary Azure resources for TimeXtender Application Server?
question_6.explanation: Deploying the necessary Azure resources for TimeXtender Application Server generally takes around 15 minutes.

question_7.question: What is the default port number that should be set for a publicly accessible AWS RDS SQL Database?
question_7.explanation: The default port for Microsoft SQL Server, which is the engine type for AWS RDS SQL Database, is 1433.

question_8.question: Which AWS service is used to create a virtual machine for SQL Server?
question_8.explanation: AWS Lightsail is the service mentioned for creating a virtual machine for SQL Server.

question_9.question: What is the first step to use Azure Analysis Services as a target for the Semantic Layer Endpoint?

options.option_a: Create an App Registration in Azure Active Directory
options.option_b: Deploy the Semantic Model in TimeXtender
options.option_c: Create an Analysis Services Resource in Azure
options.option_d: Assign the App Registration as Analysis Services Admin

question_9.explanation: The first step is to create an Analysis Services Resource in Azure, which can be skipped if you already have one.

question_10.question: Where do you need to complete the App Registration for Azure Analysis Services?

options.option_a: Azure Portal > App Registrations > New Registration
options.option_d: Azure Analysis Services > Server Properties > Security

question_10.explanation: App Registration for Azure Analysis Services is done in the Azure Portal under App Registrations.

question_11.question: What is the purpose of using Azure Data Factory for data movement according to the TimeXtender guide?

options.option_a: To manage user permissions and roles within Azure
options.option_b: To transfer data directly from source to target without relying on application server resources
options.option_c: To provide a graphical interface for SQL database management
options.option_d: To encrypt data during transfer between different Azure services

question_11.explanation: Azure Data Factory transfers data directly from source to target, which is ideal for large data sets as it does not rely on the limited resources of the application server.

question_12.question: What must be installed on a local server if you want to use Azure Data Factory to transfer data from a non-Azure data source?
question_12.explanation: A Self-Hosted Integration Runtime must be installed on the local server if you are connecting to a data source not related to Azure, such as a local SQL database.

question_13.question: What type of storage account is recommended for hosting an ODX database in Azure Data Lake?
question_13.explanation: The recommended account type for hosting an ODX database in Azure Data Lake is StorageV2 (general-purpose v2), as it supports a hierarchical namespace.

question_14.question: What must be enabled on the Azure Storage Account to use it with TimeXtender for Azure Data Lake Storage?
question_14.explanation: The Hierarchical namespace must be enabled on the Azure Storage Account to organize files into a hierarchy, which is necessary for Azure Data Lake Storage.

question_15.question: What is the first step when configuring read access to an Azure SQL Database according to the provided text?

options.option_a: Run a script in SSMS to create a user from an external provider
options.option_b: Deploy the security tab in TimeXtender
options.option_c: Give admin privileges to the user making the initial changes
options.option_d: Set the user as the Azure Active Directory admin

question_15.explanation: The first step is to give admin privileges to the user making the initial changes, as stated in the text.

question_16.question: How do you assign an Azure Active Directory user as the admin for an Azure SQL Database?

options.option_a: Run the CREATE USER script in SSMS
options.option_b: In the Azure portal, set your user as the admin using the 'Set admin' option
options.option_c: Deploy the security tab in TimeXtender
options.option_d: Add the user manually in the TimeXtender desktop application

question_16.explanation: To set a user as the admin, you use the 'Set admin' option in the Azure portal, as described in the text.

question_17.question: What is the first step to create an Azure Synapse Dedicated SQL Pool according to the provided text?

options.option_a: Create a Server Level Firewall Rule
options.option_b: In the Azure Portal, click 'Create a Resource' and type 'Dedicated SQL Pool'
options.option_c: Right-click the Instance > Edit Instance > Create Storage...

question_17.explanation: The first step listed under 'Create an Azure Synapse Dedicated SQL Pool' is to go to the Azure Portal and click 'Create a Resource', then type 'Dedicated SQL Pool'.

question_18.question: Which authentication method uses the logged-in Windows user's credentials for authentication, provided that the user is logged in using Azure AD credentials from a domain that is federated with Azure AD?
question_18.explanation: Azure AD Integrated Authentication uses the logged-in Windows user's credentials for authentication when the user is logged in using Azure AD credentials from a domain that is federated with Azure AD.

question_19.question: What is the default port number used when configuring a Snowflake Data Warehouse instance in TimeXtender?
question_19.explanation: The default port for Snowflake is 443, as mentioned in the configuration steps for Data Warehouse Instance Storage.

question_20.question: Where can you find the Snowflake Account Identifier in the Snowflake portal?

options.option_b: Admin > Accounts > Next to your account ID

question_20.explanation: The Snowflake Account Identifier can be found by navigating to Admin > Accounts and then clicking the link next to your account ID.

question_21.question: Which AWS service is recommended for hosting the TimeXtender application according to the provided architecture?
question_21.explanation: AWS EC2 is recommended for serving the TimeXtender application in AWS, as it allows for sizing according to the solution's requirements.

question_22.question: What is the recommended instance type for moderate workloads of TimeXtender on AWS EC2?
question_22.explanation: The recommended EC2 instance type for moderate workloads is t2.2xlarge, which provides 8 vCPUs and 32 GiB of memory.

question_23.question: What is the recommended Azure Virtual Machine (VM) size for moderate workloads in TimeXtender's Azure reference architecture?
question_23.explanation: DS2_v2 is recommended for moderate workloads according to the Azure VM Sizes documentation.

question_24.question: Which feature must be enabled when creating ADLS Gen2 data lake service for use with TimeXtender?
question_24.explanation: Hierarchical Namespaces must be enabled for the ADLS Gen2 data lake service when setting it up for TimeXtender.

question_25.question: What is the recommended Azure Virtual Machine size for moderate workloads when setting up TimeXtender in Azure?
question_25.explanation: DS2_v2 is recommended for moderate workloads according to the Azure VM Sizes documentation.

question_26.question: Which feature must be enabled when creating ADLS Gen2 data lake service for use with TimeXtender?
question_26.explanation: Hierarchical Namespaces must be enabled for the ADLS Gen2 data lake service when setting it up for TimeXtender.

question_27.question: What environment is recommended to serve the TimeXtender application on-premise?
question_27.explanation: The text recommends using a Windows environment such as Windows Server, sized according to the solution's requirements, to serve the TimeXtender application on-premise.

question_28.question: Which SQL Server version is recommended for ODX Server Storage database creation in TimeXtender?
question_28.explanation: SQL Server 2017 or higher is recommended for ODX Server Storage database creation in TimeXtender.

question_29.question: What is the recommended Azure Virtual Machine (VM) size for moderate workloads when setting up TimeXtender in the cloud?
question_29.explanation: DS2_v2 is recommended for moderate workloads according to the Azure VM Sizes documentation.

question_30.question: Which feature must be enabled when creating the ADLS Gen2 data lake service for TimeXtender?
question_30.explanation: Hierarchical Namespaces must be enabled when creating the ADLS Gen2 data lake service for TimeXtender.

question_31.question: Which of the following objects can be skipped during the migration process without manual changes or deletions?
question_31.explanation: Data Exports are mentioned as objects that cannot be migrated but can be skipped during migration, meaning no manual changes or deletions are required before continuing with the migration.

question_32.question: What must be done with a project variable of type 'System' and value 'Environment Name' before migration?

options.option_a: It can be migrated without changes.
options.option_b: It must be manually changed or deleted.
options.option_c: It can be ignored during migration.

question_32.explanation: The text specifies that a project variable of type 'System' and value 'Environment Name' cannot be migrated and must be manually changed or deleted prior to migration.

question_33.question: What is a new feature of TimeXtender SaaS that enhances automation capabilities within Azure?

options.option_a: Support for Snowflake as a Data Warehouse target storage
options.option_b: Run PowerShell scripts in Execution Packages
options.option_c: Goodbye License Keys and Client Secrets
options.option_d: Simplified Multiple-Environment management & transfer in the portal

question_33.explanation: TimeXtender SaaS now allows users to run PowerShell scripts in Execution Packages, which unlocks significant automation capabilities within Azure.

question_34.question: Which of the following features from TimeXtender v20.10 is NOT present in the new SaaS version?

options.option_c: User sign-in and granular user permission management

question_34.explanation: Business Units are one of the features from TimeXtender v20.10 that are no longer present in the new SaaS version.

question_35.question: What should you do before upgrading TimeXtender according to the Pre-Upgrade Checklist?
question_35.explanation: Before upgrading TimeXtender, it is important to ensure all deployments have completed to prevent any loss of data or interruption in service.

question_36.question: How do you prepare the TimeXtender services on the App Server before an upgrade?

options.option_c: Stop the services and set their Startup Type to Disabled

question_36.explanation: The TimeXtender ODX Service and the TimeXtender Execution Service should be stopped and their Startup Type set to Disabled to prepare for the installation of new versions of these services.
